title: This is tomorrow Exhibition Catalouge bodytext
content:
I’m having trouble putting my finger on this font. It seems familiar but the non-ligning figures (6,9) are throwing me off, could they be from an altogether different family? It’s printed offset litho. Any ideas?

Thanks in advance.

fb

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [this\_is\_tomorrow.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091127102743/http:/typophile.com/files/this_is_tomorrow.jpg) | 587.55 KB |
author: Fred Birdsall

comments.content: Looks like an old typewriter font to me (see missing o in “New Y rk”).

I thought it might have been a typewriter font.

I think I was thrown as its not been set as fixed width, because the majority of text in the specimen I have has been set fully justified.

Thanks

Fontgrube.
